meanings.definition: To hit or strike with great force.
meanings.sent1: He zonked the ball with his bat during the game.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter zonked the nail into the wood with a hammer.
meanings.sent3: The chef zonked the dough to make it flat for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The storm zonked the trees, bending them with its powerful winds.
meanings.sent5: The teacher zonked the chalk on the board to get the students' attention.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to become unconscious.
meanings.sent1: The boxer zonked his opponent with a strong punch.
meanings.sent2: The medicine zonked him out before the surgery.
meanings.sent3: The lullaby zonked the baby into a deep sleep.
meanings.sent4: The knockout punch zonked him cold on the mat.
meanings.sent5: The anesthesia zonked him into dreamland before the operation.

meanings.definition: To astonish or overwhelm with a strong emotion.
meanings.sent1: The surprise party zonked her with joy and happiness.
meanings.sent2: The breathtaking view zonked him with awe.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected win zonked the team into celebration.
meanings.sent4: The heartfelt letter zonked her with gratitude and tears.
meanings.sent5: The thrilling movie ending zonked the audience with excitement.
